name: IOI (International Olympiad in Informatics)
description: International Olympiad in Informatics problems testing algorithmic problem-solving, data structures, and competitive programming at the highest level.

metrics.name: score
metrics.definition: Total points earned on IOI tasks (typically 600 points maximum across 6 problems over 2 days)

metrics.name: medal_threshold
metrics.definition: Whether score meets gold/silver/bronze medal cutoffs
metrics.calculation: Based on official IOI medal boundaries (gold typically ~450-500+/600)

test_method: Present IOI competition tasks requiring algorithm design and implementation. Evaluate on extensive test suites with partial credit for subtasks. Time limits and memory constraints apply.
notes: IOI tests advanced algorithms (graph theory, dynamic programming, computational geometry) with strict time/memory limits. Document execution environment, allowed libraries, and whether debugging/retries were permitted. Partial scoring on subtasks is standard.
